title: Stabilizing Iterator::intersperse breaks a large number of crates

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-blocked
labels.description: Status: marked as blocked ❌ on something else such as an RFC or other implementation work.

body:
The 1.56 crater run shows that there are at least 59 root crates (or repositories) broken by this change, and 260 crates.io crates along with 278 github repositories which depend on those.

See https://crater-reports.s3.amazonaws.com/beta-1.56-2/index.html > "regressed: root results" > E0034 for the root crates.

cc some threads with partial discussion:

* https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/241545-t-release/topic/possible.20semi-breaking.20change.20in.20next.20release
* https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/88878

Nominating for T-libs-api discussion as the FCP on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/79524 seems to have been made without commentary about the expected level of breakage, so I suspect it was not discussed.
